summary: Extra highlighting of typedefs, enumerations etc (based on ctags)
name: CTAGS-Highlighting
description:
This set of scripts is designed to increase the number of highlighting groups used by Vim.  This makes it quicker and easier to spot errors in your code.  By using ctags and parsing the output, the typedefs, #defines, enumerated names etc are all clearly highlighted in different colours.

The idea was based on the comments in :help tag-highlight, but I wanted to take it a little further.

This is achieved through a little python script to interact with ctags and to parse the result and a small Vim script that makes Vim read the resulting files.  Finally, a new command (:UpdateTypesFile) is added (with optional ! for recursive operation) to keep the generated files up to date.

At present, the highlighter supports the following languages:
C/C++
Java
Perl
PHP (experimental)
Python
Ruby (largely untested)
VHDL
Adding more languages is extremely simple.

To show the benefit of this plugin, there are some screenshots and a more detailed description at the following website:

http://sites.google.com/site/abudden/contents/Vim-Scripts/ctags-highlighting
install_details:
Requires python (but not a python-enabled vim).  A windows executable version, which doesn't require python, is available at:

http://sites.google.com/site/abudden/contents/Vim-Scripts/ctags-highlighting

It also requires a few extra highlighting groups to be defined (using :highlight).  Run :UpdateTypesFile and look at the list at the bottom of the resulting types_*.vim files.  Alternatively, install the Bandit colour scheme from vimscript #2645: this provides all the groups by default.  The full list is also provided in the included documentation.

versions.release_notes: Allow customisation of the filenames used for tags and types files (thanks to Sung Pae).
Improved type prioritisation for object-oriented languages.
Added better support for different C++ extensions and to avoid conflicts with C# files.
Changed default to not include syntax matches unless either g:TypesFileIncludeSynMatches or b:TypesFileIncludeSynMatches is set to 1 (this makes the highlighting much faster for large projects).

Better support for paths with spaces in them.  Added support for Android SDK and Java JDK (requires latest gui_types_and_tags from the website).  Optional local variable highlighting (see caveats on the website) for Java, C# and C++ as well as C.
Added support for ctags 'import' type in python.
Significantly improved support for languages other than C.  Factored out redundant ctags_* intermediate highlight groups.
Better support for different languages including support for C# (thanks to Aleksey Baibarin).
Fixed bug in new vimfiles location operation.

Improvements to VIMFILESDIR identification.  Re-architecture of type definitions to make them more sensitive to different ctags "kinds" for different languages.  Note that Enumerator has been renamed to EnumerationValue: the latest Bandit Colour Scheme supports this.  Fixed escaping of paths and operation of ReadTypes when not in an autocommand.
Added missing winrestview() call (thanks to Yongwei Wu for reporting this).
Added experimental PHP support and a lot more documentation.
Added shellescape() to GUI types and tags files and moved them out of the main distribution (see update 7th August 2009 on the website).
Fixed bug with (optional) cscope database generation.
Fix for Linux spaced paths (Mikhail Stepura).
Added support for ctags being stored in a path with spaces and other odd characters (thanks to Mikhail Stepura).

Changed some of the defaults to the python script (so fewer options need to be passed by UpdateTypesFile).  It should now be possible to generate the types file simply by running "mktypes.py" or "mktypes.py -r" in the project directory.  Of course, UpdateTypesFile still works too.  Added UpdateTypesFileOnly command for projects in which the tags file is updated externally (e.g. the Linux kernel source).  Removed regular expression matches by default: this is much quicker for large projects.  Also added more screenshots to the website.
